Alain Ravet wrote:

> Hard to say without an example, but in such a case, I would simply
> change the visibility of the method from private to package
> (in java). As I put the tests in the same package, but in another
> source tree, that would do the trick.
> 
> Should I have to make its "unpublished" quality more obvious, I'd add
> a big red (html)  "FOR TEST ONLY - DON'T USE" in the javadoc of the
> method. 

Reasonable strategy. In the face of the tools I currently use, I'd
probably think about alternatively deprecating it (in Eclipse, use of a
deprecated method can be made very obvious, whereas I rather seldom take
a look into javadoc).

Regards, Ilja
